revised_title: The Establishment and Administration of the Scientific Relief Fund
tldr: The article discusses the establishment of the Scientific Relief Fund by the Royal Society in 1859, which aimed to provide financial assistance to scientists and their families in need. The fund was proposed by John Peter Gassiot and supported by members of the Philosophical Club. The article also outlines the administration and changes made to the fund over the years, including the selection of a committee to manage the distribution of funds.
